headline: Quick and Easy Chicken Spaghetti
description: A chicken spaghetti recipe that's quick and easy to make with chopped cooked chicken and angel hair simmered in a cheesy cream sauce with tomatoes.
name: Quick and Easy Chicken Spaghetti
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chile peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook angel hair pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes.
Add chopped chicken, condensed soup, diced tomatoes with chile peppers, processed cheese, mushrooms, salt, and pepper.
Cook and stir over low heat until cheese is melted and mixture is heated through, about 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This is the best quick chicken spaghetti I have ever made. It is really delicious.

Wife said it's going in the rotation, pretty good. I used a half can of milk to clean out the soup can like another suggested. I'll use a whole can of milk next time. Maybe a whole can will make it a little more creamy.. The sauce is very thick with all that cheese. It could be a chip dip with no extra liquid in it as another also used it for.
Mine turned out perfectly. Easy recipe if you have all the ingredients.

I added veggies: 1/2 diced onion 3 cloves garlic minced 1/2 diced red bell pepper 1/2 diced green bell pepper 6 sliced baby bella mushrooms Splash white wine Red pepper flake to taste Italian seasoning to taste dried/fresh parsely Topped with add'l shredded cheddar cheese.

I made this as something new for my family. I added diced onions and bell pepper for more flavor. We were all underwhelmed by the recipe and had a bright idea. Since I did not mix the sauce with the noodles, we all tried the sauce & chicken mixture with tortilla chips. A NEW HOUSE FAVORITE WAS BORN! We have been scouring the internet for new recipes and this is one that we all loved. Will definitely make again.

Very good! I did have to modify it just a little by deleting the mushrooms (due to allergies), but I added sliced olives and saut√©ed onions/green bell peppers. Without a doubt I will make this again!!!
This was very simple to put together nd very delicious. I added garlic bread with it and it was great!

I made this for my boyfriend to try. We live in the North Pacific and he had never had it before. It was one of my favorite meals when I lived in the south though. I added a can of cream of mushroom to the mix and it made it that much better. He said it was amazing.

I doubled the recipe with a whole chicken and 16 oz of pasta. It tastes incredibly good. You can use any type of cream soup in this. I also added shred parmesan and garlic salt. This stuff is amazing. And easy!
Great recipe. This recipe was a great hit with my non-mushroom eaters. I added cream cheese. Will definitely make again.

My pot is empty. I did adjust based off of family needs. I used regular spaghetti noodles (my husband hates angel hair texture) and I doubled the sauce and added some milk to the sauce to thin it some, we like lots of sauce. I used the white Velveeta cheese as well. I think next time instead of the second can of Rotel I will add green chiles (husband and 1 kid picked over the tomatoes).
left out the mushrooms added a little sour cream. worked great and tasted awesome
One of my family's favorite. I use Velveeta cheese but I mix in my soups with it as well as rotel tomatoes and add a little milk and melt first, that ways it's much easier to mix everything together.
I left out the mushrooms; And it was delicious.
Used 2 cans of Cream of Mushroom soup, and the whole 8 oz of Velveeta. Next time, will use spaghetti instead of angel hair. Good, quick and easy.
I omitted the mushrooms due to family members allergies. However the meal was delicious and sadly I was left without leftovers. Total satisfaction.

The 1st 2 times I made this I followed the recipe exactly. It was the most awesome comfort food, and is on my permanent rotation of family meals. As written, it is delicious, so this time, I got adventurous and added undrained Rotel, 1/4 tsp. onion powder, and 1/4 tsp. of garlic powder, and it was even better. DO NOT add salt. When I did, it was way too salty. Don‚Äôt know why I added it anyway. Thank you for this great meal, and a big thank you for ALLRECIPES.
yes did not add tomatoes or mushrooms to it. Next time I will add some chicken broth to it because it was kind of dry and add more seasoning, Tasted a little bland

This was easy and quick. I chose this recipe because it used cream of chicken and not cream of mushroom. I also did not add the mushrooms. I have really picky eater and I had no complaints. Next time I would drain the rotel to tone down the spice a little but even with out draining it wasn‚Äôt overly spicy.
I love this! Quick and easy. I did add a can of cream of mushroom on top of the other. Also added garlic and onions.
Saut√©ed an onion in a little oil and garlic before adding Rotel tomatoes and soup. I used 4 heaping tablespoons of cheeze whiz as it‚Äôs the only cheese I had on hand....delicious!
Delicious!

Really good as is! This is a great basic recipe to which you can add other ingredients to suit your taste. I I have added diced onion and red & green bell peppers which I cooked with the pasta to save washing another pot.

No changes and it was delicious ,yes ill make it again and every time im in the mood for it and when i need something quick and delicious not to mention fast and very easy for when i get company in time for lunch or dinner !
This recipe turned out great I will definitely be making it again!!!!
Followed exactly as is and it was amazing! My foodie husband loved it
No, my students and I made it as it was written.
Made the exact recipe. It was delicious and leftovers were better.
I will make it again! Thanks for the selections for this recipe!

So I had to substitute thin spaghetti for angel hair, and I didn‚Äôt have any jarred mushrooms on hand-But-I did use the 8oz of Velveeta, the (drained) can of Rotel, 2 cups of cooked, cubed chicken breast, and the can of crm of chicken soup, so the base flavors were all there. This was just too much like glue for me, tbh. The flavor wasn‚Äôt bad, but it quickly turned into a solid-matter dish...Though I did think it was a creative way to use up leftover seasoned chicken breast. I just wish the texture could have stayed creamy, instead of it tasting much too heavy as soon as it came off of the heat. The few bites I had before that happened were pretty good though! Would not make again, however.
i used Velveeta cheese and seasoned my meat with Louisianan Cajun seasoning

Good for the man!! 
Made a cream sauce with diced onion for the cream of soup, used chicken bouillon to taste, used fire roasted diced tomato and cheddar cheese. Wanted spice so dissolved about 1/4 cup FF jalapenos ( comes in a container like fried onions ) with the cheese. Made a nice thick cheesy sauce, added cooked pasta and the leftover diced chicken, put in casserole, topped with bread crumbs because I was feeling fancy, and baked till bubbly...made a lovely garlic bread....

Not really the same dish...but somehow I got there starting with your idea!! Thank you for helping me use what I have instead of wasteful living!!!
the only thing I changed was the pasta I used thin spaghetti noodles instead of angel hair and I baked it. It turned out great even the pickiest of the four liked it and asked for seconds.
good
This was awesome! Substitute the cheddar cheese for Velveeta cheese and sauteed mushrooms perfect!
Easy is a understatement. Best recipe ever. I did add a can of hatch green chillies to it also.

This is delicious! I had canned chicken that I needed a recipe for and this worked perfect. I added some garlic salt and some dill weed to give it a bit more flavor and used regular diced tomatoes since I'm not a fan of spicy. I did not have processed cheese so I used shredded cheddar cheese which melted easily. I also added some water while it was simmering, and sprinkled parsley flakes on top before serving. Yes I can see us making this again! Thank you!
Adding this to my Quick and Easy recipes list. Kids seems to like it. The sauce was a little dry so I added 1/2 cup of milk and 2 tbsp. butter.
Very good we really liked it will make it again.
Had this for dinner. It was good.
Dang it was so good. I definitely recommend and it was quick
It was fast easy and a nice change of pace. I added broccoli , peas and more celery.
Came out kind of pasty. Next time I will finish it with water, chicken broth or cream. Just needed more liquid but the taste was right there - very good.

Really easy meal to make and tastes great! I omitted the mushrooms, but followed the rest of the recipe exactly. I was looking for a different sauce to put on pasta since my husband doesn't like marinara. This was a hit with both of us. Will definitely make again. Thanks!

Great recipe. Easy. The kids loved it! 
I used a rotisserie chicken and added diced sauteed green bell peppers. The sauce was a little thick, so I would suggest adding a little water or milk. I also put it in a casserole dish to mix it all together, topped it with shredded cheese and put it in the oven for a few minutes to melt the cheese. Delicious!!!

This is pretty good. I cut the amount of Veleveeta in half and added an equal amount of sharp cheddar to it. 
I used cream of mushroom soup instead of the cream of chicken and jar of mushrooms
Baked it at 350 degrees for 40 min
I used cream of mushroom instead of fresh mushrooms and added a can of tomato soup. This is a famIly favorite. So good!!
Made as per the Recipe, family loved it.

Very good for a quick meal. Easy to please. I do add cream of mushroom too. You can also toss it all into a casserole dish with extra cheese and buttered cracker crumbs on top then toast at 350 for 5-10 min

Husband loved it....I did make some alterations - used leftover rotisserie chicken and grated cheddar cheese ( I don't use processed cheese). Put the cheese, soup & tomatoes into a glass container and microwaved a minute or so - just to melt the cheese. Added my cooked quinoa veggie curls and tossed it all into a dish. Heated in the oven at 350 for about 15 min. We each ate 2 helpings!

I found a hack that I think works great: a jar of creamy alfredo sauce in place of cream of chicken soup, a can of Rotel - blend together to smooth out the chunks, add shredded chicken, noodles and Mexican and cheddar cheeses. Top w/extra cheese and Bake at 350 for 20-30 min.
Super easy to make and one of my favorite comfort foods.

Nice recipe, I will definitely use it again. I did do a few things differently though. The pasta was kind of dry for my taste following the original recipe. So I used 1.5 cans of cream of chicken, cream of mushroom, and rotel. I used Velveeta shredded cheese instead of cubed cheese (it melted wonderfully). I used Tyson already cooked grilled chicken breast, it's seasoned really well and tender. Turned out great, kids loved it and they're a hard to please bunch.
I made this for the first time to take to my parents' home. Rave reviews! My Mom said that she just couldn't stop eating it! I fixed it exactly as the recipe stated. Thanks for sharing!
Good! I added a can of cream of mushroom soup and used rotel. A tad too cheesy for us but overall great meal!

I made this tonight to use up leftover chicken. I didn't have tomatoes so I used salsa and a dash of hot sauce. For the cheese, I grated some cheddar, and also used some jalape√±o laughing cow. I mixed it up, put it in a casserole dish, topped it with French fried onions and baked it. I could have eaten the whole pot. Delicious.

Good quick dish. Shredded a rotisserie chicken to make it easy and not have that canned chicken flavor/texture. Made as directed. Easy to make any number of additions next time. Diced Romas, pimentos, or maybe some sundried tomatoes.
Huge hit at my house. Finally a recipe my picky 8 yearly will eat!
I like this recipe, The whole family loved it!

I love this recipe! My husband is not big on pasta dishes, so I made it for my lunches for the week. I cut the pasta down to 2 cups and the Velveeta down to 6 oz and used can chicken, just for convenience and I thought it was great! There was nice spice from the Rotel, but not too much.
Pretty good, we did not have chicken so I just left that ingredient out. I also used jalapeno velveeta cheese and it was just the right level of spiciness
My family can eat about anything but this was awful. It was basically cheese dip with chicken, same recipe.Bad. So plain.
This was a really good recipe and I will definitely be making this again. I used 8oz of shredded cheese instead and I think that made it better.

I only gave it 4 stars because I didn't follow the exact recipe. I made my own cream of chicken soup, used reduced fat colby jack, chopped my own tomatoes and green chiles and since the Hubs doesn't like mushrooms, I used canned artichoke hearts and just rinsed them really well and chopped them. I also used whole grain wheat spaghetti to make it more diabetic friendly. It's one of our favorites and pretty quick despite all the fresh cooking I do.

Who would have thought this would be soooo good! Made it on a whim, using stuff that I had on hand...DELIGHTFUL!! I used cream of mushroom soup, and I think next time I will add the mushrooms, perhaps some bell pepper and onions. We had it two nights in a row, and it was still tasty. Thanks for sharing this wonderful recipe.
It's easy, quick, delicious and satisfying!
great freeze ahead meal.
delicious, good as left-overs, hubby loved it
This meal is super easy and so delicious. Added pepper and left the recipe as is.

This is a great recipe however I add some extras that takes it to WOW! I boil my chicken in jalapenos and green chilies and use the same water for my pasta. I then add extra green chilies to the dish as I am mixing it. If you want it spicier than add more jalapenos to it.

I made the same thing just sauteed some chopped onion before adding the rotel and cheese. I left out the cream of chicken soup and the mushrooms and it was still really yummy. I'll try it with the cream of chicken soup next time.

This is very easy to make and quick that's for sure! I was very surprised how delicious this was! I used spaghetti Rigati noodles, ROTEL tomatoes w/green chilies for some kick, skinless chicken breast, fat free cream of chicken soup and mild cheddar cubed cheese. This dish was so smooth but spicy. I loved it! If I wasnt allergic to mushrooms those would definitly be in the dish as I could see how that would be a fabulous addition. Thanks for sharing! I will absolutely try this again!

I used cooked salmon in place of the chicken. For me, this dish is ok because the chile peppers are very over-powering, but my husband likes it. My children finish theirs too. I'll probably make it again, but not for myself.
I followed exactly and it was delicious!Just what I was looking for. Will be making again. Thanks!!

This was so quick and easy! I sauteed half of a green bell pepper, about 1/3 of an onion, and some garlic powder and added that in. I also used fresh mushrooms instead of canned. Absolutely delicious! Next time I would probably use a little less Velveeta.

I used 1 1/2lb of chicken breasts & grilled them on the stove top with a generous sprinkling of Montreal Chicken Seasoning. Sauteed 1/2 a green pepper & onion in separate pan. Added a family size can of cream of mushroom soup, 2 mild cans of Rotel, & a large can of mushrooms. Used pasta shells & a small loaf of Velveeta. Baked in the oven for 30 minutes @ 350 degrees. Was extremely bland, BUT Sriracha added to my bowl made this meal outstanding! Dont know if I would eat it without the Sriracha. My husband & oldest son liked it-not a hit with the 7 yr old. Would probably make again in a pinch.

I was actually surprised how good this was, especially for how easy it was to make - the tomatoes/chiles adds a GREAT touch!! I did use fresh mushrooms instead of canned, and added a little more Velveeta than it called for, but i don't think either of those things changed the recipe enough to say the original wasn't already very very good. Would definitely make this again.
Tastes great! Has a nice kick to it and really hard to mess up.

Very good recipe for those evenings that you're rushed. I did add a little Chipotle Tobasco sauce for just a little more kick & used cream of mushroom (DH won't eat mushrooms, so I snuck them in this way :-)

This was simple and really good. I used fresh mushrooms and added green onions. I cooked them with my chicken Also added some red pepper flakes and garlic to my chicken while it cooked. Had a great flavor. I didn't have cream of chicken so had to use cream of mushroom, still turned out great. Will use the cream of chicken next time, but think cream of anything would work.
Added minced onion & garlic. Made it better. Too bland for us as written. It still is lacking something.

I must not be a fan of chicken spaghetti recipes because this is the second one I tried and it was not anything to write home about. I agree with another reviewer who said it tasted fake. I even used shredded cheddar cheese instead of the processed cheese. I also used salsa (as another reviewer suggested) instead of the diced tomatoes which added a little kick. But it was still just a little blah. I probably won't make it again.

My hubby and I loved it, but kids thought it was too spicy - will make 2 batches next time -one with Rotel, other with seasoned diced tomatoes. I used piccolini pasta also and it worked perfectly. Thanks for a quick, tasty recipe!
This is an excellent mid week meal for the family! We love it!

this was so easy and so yummy! I made a couple changes i did 1/2 mozzarella shredded cheese and 1/2 cream cheese it made it super creamy. I did 1/2 can of cream of chicken soup and 1/2 can of cream of mushroom soup due to others suggestions. I sauteed onions with the chicken when cooking the chicken. I also used real tomatoes. the spice from the green peppers was great! I recommend bread sticks as a side. will do again!

this was delicious. i didnt have mushrooms so i put 1 can of cream of chicken and 1 can of cream of mushroom. fresh boiled chicken breast instead of canned chicken, and i also used 1/2 block of velveeta instead of the processed cheese it calls for. added salt, pepper, and some garlic powder and it was really good. and super EASY!!! loved it. will definately make again.

Quicky, easy, and good. In Texas, I was taught to also add a can of Cream of Mushroom to the recipe. I also learned that Velveeta is the favorite to use since it melts so well. Some people drain the Rotel, and some don't. (It's spicier if you keep the liquid though). Either way is good to me. I know a few people who use canned chunked chicken (like canned tuna, but chicken) to make it that much quicker to make. Occasionally, I like to add diced celery, pimentos, onions, garlic, and garlic powder (depending on my mood). No matter what, it's fool proof! You can't go wrong! The best one I ever tasted was baked, and it wasn't too cheesy (which is good because I'm not fond of things that are too cheesy). It was just creamy (not too creamy) and good! Good starting off point for people who have never had it before though! I like to serve it with garlic toast (or that garlic Texas Toast you find in the freezer section of your grocery store), and green beans (fresh or canned). Try it out! You can always tweak it as much or as little as you like!
Thought it was a little blahh tasting. Would make a good quick easy dinner.
My first time making chicken spaghetti. Used a box of shell pasta, 8 oz of shredded cheddar, and it turned out really creamy. I thought it could use a little more flavor, but overall ok.
This was a pretty good take on chicken spaghetti. . .I used Rotel and it was a little too spicy for me, but that was my own fault--next time I'll make sure I get the mild Rotel.

A great recipe but I changed it a bit. I baked my chicken first and I also used some mushroom and 2 portions of Velveeta so it wouldnt be so salty. Insteady I mostly used shredded cheese and a lil bit of celery. I also used whole wheat noodles. But great recipe

didn't like it much. we usually don't cook with 'cream of...soup', so i think it just tasted fake. also a little too spicy for my 2 year old with the rotel tomotoes. if i was making it again, i'd use regular diced. oh well, i like trying something new, now we know this wasn't a home run for our family.

OH MY GOSH is that good!! I used one can of regular Rotel, one Cream of Mushroom soup, one 4 oz jar of mushrooms and shredded cheese. Wish I had used low fat cheese and less cheese in order to lower the fat content ~ next time. I also used Quinoa spaghetti instead of regular spaghetti to get away from the gluten. It was really awesome. It's in my favorites for sure.
I used salsa instead of rotel and shredded cheddar instead of velveeta. It was a good, solid weeknight meal that was quick and easy.
Very good. I used K&N's tandoori chicken cubes hence was not sure how it would turn out. It was very good. :) Also added some Tabasco sauce (about 1 tsp) to it. My recipe was for 2 servings only.
This was awesome I'm going to continue making this its easy to put together and satisfying.I just added extra freshh tomatos made it more appealing to me.
My picky toddler ate it, so that's enough for me! Used penne, regular diced tomatoes instead of rotel, and added grated mexican cheese blend.
I did not like this and will not make again.

I made a few changes to make it a really fast meal to make. I know it would taste even better as it is originally written, but I used canned chicken and shredded cheese. I also used regular diced tomatoes because I don't like spicy food. My family loves this. My kids can't get enough of it.
